meanings.definition: A group of cows or cattle.
meanings.sent1: The farmer led his kyne to the pasture for grazing.
meanings.sent2: The kyne were peacefully grazing in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dog tried to chase the kyne, but they ignored him.
meanings.sent4: The kyne stood together like a silent, swaying forest.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the kyne under the golden sun was a picture of serenity.

meanings.definition: To give birth to a calf.
meanings.sent1: The cow will kyne in the spring, adding a new member to the herd.
meanings.sent2: The mother cow kyne with ease, welcoming the newborn calf.
meanings.sent3: The farm animals gathered around to witness the cow kyne in the barn.
meanings.sent4: The fields echoed with the sounds of a cow kyning in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The farmer eagerly awaited the moment when his cow would kyne.

meanings.sent1: The kyne grazed peacefully in the lush green meadow.
meanings.sent2: The farmer took good care of his prized kyne.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous calf kept nudging its mother, the kyne.
meanings.sent4: The kyne's gentle eyes reflected a sense of calm.
meanings.sent5: The young kyne frolicked in the field, enjoying the sunshine.
